page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT PLEAN/COWIE
page.content: This has traditionally been a mining area. There are few miners in the villages now. The nearest working mine is Polmaise near Fallin but it is under threat of closure (which was one of the reasons for the recent miners' strike). Farmers are employing fewer workers because of more sophisticated farming machinery. Children traditionally worked at the potato lifting in the autumn but this is also done by machinery now. Some villagers used to work in the cigarette factory in Stirling that closed because of a drop in sales. With the closing of Carron Iron Works and Iron foundries in Larbert many men in the area became unemployed.
